The indicator can respond to pressures on the marine environment that impact individual fish directly (entrapment activities) or indirectly (through change in their seabed or pelagic habitat, primary production and food-web interactions). The indicator is aggregated at the survey level within each region assessed and complemented by subdivisional analyses at a scale appropriate to pressures and habitats that can be highly localised.
